title: I want to get IP BANNED because im an addict, please help me
body: I JUST WANT TO GET IP BANNED, ive been addicted to video games for a long time but league of legends has been the most toxic to my life,  i uninstalled the game hundred of times, been banned and made a hundred other accounts, the only solution is to get ip banned, i will give any info needed to prove that its not a joke or whatever , RIOT , if u guys have any heart you will listen to me and IP ban me , give me a chance to live a good life please

An IP ban won't help you.  You can get around an IP ban easily, or you could just move your problem to a different game.  There is no action Riot can take that would actually help you here, they can only slow you down.

Sit down with some close friends and family and tell them what is going on.  You have to open up to people who actually know you IRL.  No one can fix this problem for you, but if you have people to stand at your side you can get your life back.

I KNOW its in my head but im weak , friends cant help , family cant help , i went to addict centers , only made me dream of getting out to play , anyway ,  if they wont ip ban me , fuck this money hungry company , this would be so simple and i see so many people addicted and depressed on this game , it makes a lot of people crazy , i just want a simple IP BAN riot , i wont ask for anything more ...     ps: i never had this problem with any other game, YES i always played a lot, but i had fun , i wasnt depressed and angry all the time

This game is not the problem.  You are the problem.

An IP ban will not physically work to keep you from playing.  That's not how it works.  Even if it did work you would find something else to fill the void it leaves behind.  Avoiding the problem does not solve it.

The thing that feels easy to do is to go back and play, right?  The reason it feels like friends and family can't help is because that takes you the furthest away from what is easy.  Friends and family can help.  They are the only thing that can help.  They are the path away from this self destructive behavior, and they are the stability you need right now.

There is nothing in this world that Riot can do to help you if you won't first help yourself.

If you have all the money, then hire a therapist. 

Will be the best money you've spent.

Gaming Addictions are part of DSM5 now, and will be treated like any addiction.

Sorry but Riot doesn't do IP bans for two main reasons.

1. They're easy to get around with enough technical knowledge.
2. They can easily cause collateral damage to innocent players.

If you wish to disable your account then file a support ticket asking for it. That said, I would highly advise seeking some professional help if your urge to be toxic online is this strong.

IP bans are an old form of ban.  They don't work well in the modern age, and in some countries they do basically nothing.  As has already been said the United States most often uses dynamic IP addresses, meaning if you don't specifically set up your network to have a static IP your IP will change periodically.  It will change and you won't have to lift as much as a finger to do it.

What that means is if an IP ban is used the banned IP will be given to someone else, and if they also play the game in question they will randomly lose access at no fault of their own.

On top of this it's insanely easy to change your IP.  That's one of the many big reasons people stopped doing IP bans, it's just so easy for the average person to get around it.

There are countries that can actually ban people from a game.  China in particular can do it, but that's because internet use there is tied to a number similar to our social security number.  You can ban access from that particular number, and that stops that person from accessing something.  Western countries do not have this.

You're asking why Riot can't do a thing, but you were told multiple times why they can't do it.  You're wishing that they could in spite of the facts right now.  This isn't about greed, it's about you looking for an easy solution to a complicated problem.

It's time for you to walk that harder road.  Go to your family and tell them what is going on.

I can think of maybe 2 or 3 others.  I think one was a ban from competative play, not a full ID ban, and was reversed after a period.  Although it triggered similar outcry about him getting "unbanned", he didn't regain any permabanned accounts, he was just allowed back into the pro circuit.

Man, take this as an opportunity to prove to yourself your ability to develop self-discipline.  That will translate into the most value to you going forward into other areas of your life.  If you feel that you need to quit, then quit and stick to your conviction by your own willpower.

By the way, IP bans will not work for most Americans at least because we have dynamic IP addresses that change periodically.  The only way Riot could probably permanently IP ban you would be to ban everyone using your Internet Service Provider in your local area.  Otherwise, your IP ban would likely be transferred to someone else within a month, which would be unfair to them and would unban you.
you are right, i would give anything needed, my physical adress or isp , anything needed to be out of this game for good, trust me i tried willpower long enough and im tired
Then an ip ban won't help. You would simply relapse and google how to change your ip address.

Trust me, you need to develop self-discipline, or another addiction will simply replace the one you are giving up.  Try to find a hobby that you can be happier obsessing over or devote yourself to career/education.  The issue you'll find with that is that you're still replacing one unfulfilling habit with another no matter what you do, and success in work or art can't make you happy forever either but they might give you something to feel good about for a while.  The trick is to keep growing and have some sense of progress balanced by a sense of freedom/control of future opportunities (more doors opening than closing) or you will fall into nihilism and despair.  For now, try to focus on what you can do to best increase your future opportunities so that you can choose which you want to pursue later in life.  I hope this advice makes sense to you.

If you have an addiction, then you should seek medical assistance. Now that has been said, IP banning, whether for your purpose or others talked about on the boards only serves to punish the *next* player who may have your IP. IPs are rarely static enough to just block.

Try going to a therapist, this seems like a serious addiction. Ask a Friend or relative to set a strict limit to the WiFi or something along those lines. Meet up with someone. Talk about your problems. Go to a trusted therapist. Start a new hobby, soccer, martial arts, something active.

ip bans don't work for a number of reasons

i suggest you seek professional help instead
